main event: A circular, yellowish-orange object the size of a pinhead was observed at Glasgow AFB, Mont., for three consecutive nights in 1958. The object appeared to twinkle and became more stationary over time.
interesting points: The object was observed to increase in intensity but not in azimuth over three consecutive nights.
It was seen by multiple witnesses, including military personnel at the Glasgow AFB control tower.
The observed object was initially thought to be a star after visual and radar investigation.
The observation provided the conclusion that the object was Arcturus.
The document indicates there were no photographs accompanying the report.
witnesses: Military personnel at Glasgow AFB control tower
